question:
Q1: What is the difference between antimicrobial agents and disinfectants?
A. Antimicrobial agents prevent the growth of bacteria on surfaces, while disinfectants remove any bacteria or germs that may be present on a surface.
B. Antimicrobial agents remove any bacteria or germs that may be present on a surface, while disinfectants prevent the growth of bacteria on surfaces.
C. Antimicrobial agents and disinfectants are the same thing.
D. Antimicrobial agents and disinfectants are both used to treat bacterial infections.

Q2: What is an example of an antibiotic?
A. Penicillin
B. Amoxicillin
C. Ibuprofen
D. Paracetamol

Q3: How can you determine what type of antibiotic resistance a bacteria has?
A. By looking at the code on the antibiotic bottle
B. By using a microscope
C. By performing a culture test
D. By using a UV light
answer:
Q1: B
Q2: A
Q3: C
